item.title: Leveraging asynchronous hardware accelerators for fun and profit
item.description: One of the greatest benefits of Persistent Memory is that it’s directly accessible by the CPU. But that can also be one of its downsides for specific use cases. For example, if you want to use PMem as an ultra-fast storage device with low access latency. PMem as storage impedance mismatch The reason for that is simple - block storage I/O is typically asynchronous due to its relatively high latency and high queue depths required to reach optimal throughputs.
